who stays dry under his little umbrella!

Born of steel, confined in a throat of walls.
I speak only in numbers and stop when called.
Seek me at the root of the realm where degrees multiply.
Guess your next location

Between two buzzing hives, I lie flat yet stand tall.
My face changes with seasons,
My voice is written, not heard.
Find me where news meets noon breaks.
Where the sweat meets the sip
No more scanning, no need to pause - just walk through the booth without a cause.
The E stands tall with knowledge bright, opposite rests a sign of insight with rainbow colours.
Where rubber rests and carbonation whispers, Time idles on crowded perches. A silent sentinel quenches none, While crimson reigns in the chamber of chill.
Who said, "Education is not the learning of facts, but the training of the mind to think"?

Born of silence, I swallow the sky's tears.
Voices converge where my shadow lies.
The watcher of hues guards my secret face â€”Seek the threshold where air and earth conspire.

Far from the hill yet close to His gaze,I dwell where echoes of faith amaze.
Noven watchful visages guard my art,
Seek where silence etches what shades impart.
Guess the Next Place??

I stand before the giant that speaks in light,
Where crowds drift past from morn to night.
My face changes with each new tale â€”Seek the watcher that never fails.

Where colors tempt yet hands must yield,
By metal steeds and gamesmen's field.
A silent sentinel guards the bloom â€”
Find where beauty forbids its own perfume.

I feed the weary with a lifeless flame,
No pulse, no breath â€” yet I restore the same.
Silent I stand where rotation come to revive,
Seek the source where motion regains its drive.

Look for a calm stone blessed by moonlight,
A serpent guards it - yet it bites none.

 only hooks, hangers, and handwritten notes that read:
 "Take what you need. Leave what you can."
What is this wall called

The highest education is that which does not merely give us Information but makes our life In harmony with all existence.

Find the person by whom these lines were said.

Every face here is a step up the ladder -
Find the wall that made the campus prouder.
